backgroundInformationList.description: Notice of Intention to Remove a Holding Symbol (H) from Zoning By-law 409-2024 - 26, 28, 36, and 38 Hounslow Avenue

noticeDescription:
NOTICE OF INTENTION TO REMOVE A HOLDING SYMBOL (H) FROM ZONING BY-LAW 409-2024

(Under the Planning Act)

 

The City has received the following application under Section 36 of the Planning Act:

Application Number: 25 153845 NNY 18 OZ

Address: 26, 28, 36, and 38 Hounslow Avenue

Ward: Ward 18 - Willowdale

Contact: Wilser Canel, Assistant Planner at 416-392-0330, by e-mail at Wilser.Canel@toronto.ca, or by address North York Civic Centre, 5100 Yonge St., North York, ON, M2N 5V7

 

DESCRIPTION

 

The application to amend Zoning By-law 409-2024 to remove the holding symbol (H) on the lands delineated by heavy black lines on Schedule 1 to permit the development of a 26-storey residential building. The By-law includes a holding provision that requires servicing measures to be addressed. The location of where the holding symbol (H) would be removed is noted on the map below.

 

Detailed information about the proposal, including background information and materials may be made available for review by contacting the Planner noted above or by visiting the City of Toronto’s Application Information Centre page for this application. 

 

MAKE YOUR VIEWS KNOWN

 

You may send written comments by mail or email to the Community Planner noted under Contact. Your written comments must be submitted no later than August 22, 2025, to be considered by the Executive Director, Development Review or their designate, Director, Community Planning, North York District. A decision by the Executive Director, Development Review or their designate as to whether to remove the holding symbol (H) will occur no earlier than September 9, 2025.

 

Notice to people writing to the City: The City of Toronto Act, 2006, the Planning Act, and the City of Toronto Municipal Code authorize the City of Toronto to collect any personal information in your communication to the City.

 

The City collects this information to enable it to make informed decisions on the relevant issue(s).  If you are submitting letters, e-mails, or other communications to the City, you should be aware that your name and the fact that you communicated with the City will become part of the public record and will appear on the City's website. The City will also make your communication and any personal information in it - such as your postal address, telephone number or e-mail address - available to the public, unless you expressly request the City to remove it.
title: Notice of Intention to Remove a Holding Symbol (H) from Zoning By-law 409-2024 - 26, 28, 36, and 38 Hounslow Avenue
